remark.ch: 生醫組為三選二，植物暨微生物環境生物組為四選一

goal.en: This course is to introduce life phenomena and function of the cell at the molecular level. The course integrates general knowledge of Biochemistry,Molecular Biology, Cell Biology, Genetics, and Physiology to explore Life phenomena at molecular and cellular levels and bring advanced knowledge of life sciences for graduate students.
goal.ch: 此課程主旨在以分子的層次解說細胞的生命現象及功能。課程目標：藉整合生命科學相關的生物化學、分子生物學、細胞學、遺傳學、生理學等基礎知識，以細胞的角度、分子的層次更深入探討生命現象及功能 ，同時增加學生在生命科學領域專業知識。

content.en:
1 2/22 Chapter 13 Intracellular vesicular traffic SL Chen
2 3/1 Holiday
3 3/8 Chapter 14 Energy conversion: mitochondria and chloroplasts CH Yeh
4 3/15 Chapter 14 Energy conversion: mitochondria and
chloroplasts CH Yeh
5 3/22 Chapter 15 mechanisms of cell communication CY Huang
6 3/29 Chapter 15 mechanisms of cell communication CY Huang
7 4/5 Holiday
7 TBA The first examination, chapters 13, 14, 15
8 4/12 Chapter 19 Cell junctions, cell adhesion, and the
extracellular matrix SL CHEN
9 4/19 Chapter 17 The cell cycle PY WU
10 4/26 Chapter 17 The cell cycle PY WU
11 5/3 Chapter 18 Apoptosis PY WU
12 5/10 Chapter 20 Cancer PY WU
12 TBA The second examination (chapters 17, 18, 19)
13 5/17 Chapter 24 Pathogens, infection, and innate immunity YH Luo
14 5/24 Chapter 24 Pathogens, infection, and innate immunity YH Luo
15 5/31 Chapter 25 The adaptive immunity YH Luo
16 6/7 Chapter 25 The adaptive immunity YH Luo
16 6/14 Holiday
17 6/21 Final examination (chapters 20, 24, 25)
Lectures: Mondays 13:00-16:00
Textbook : Molecular Biology of the Cell, eds. Alberts et al., 5th ed.
Assessment: Written exams on dates to be announced (TBA)
Course organizers:
Prof. Chen (Rm S5-305, Tel: 65069, email: slchen@cc.ncu.edu.tw)
